Cover by Patrick Tomasso on Unsplash
One Sentence Summary
ðŸ–‹
Cal Newport's blog StudyHacks and Scott Young contain the best evidence based and anecdotal resources on how to learn anything effectively.
Trustworthy Experts
Cal Newport
How to Become a Straight-A Student
Essential advice. Following his tips I have never had to study the day before an exam to get A+
How To Become a Straight-A Student
Looking to jumpstart your G.P.A? Most college students believe that straight As can only be achieved through cramming and painful all-nighters. But Cal Newport knows that real straight-A students don't study harder-they study smarter.
https://www.calnewport.com/books/straight-a-student/
How To Become A Straight A Student Summary - Four Minute Books
1-Sentence-Summary: How To Become A Straight A Student gives you the techniques A+ students have used to pass college with flying colors and summa cum laude degrees, without compromising their entire lives and spending every minute in the library, ranging from time management and note-taking tactics all the way to how you can write a great thesis.
https://fourminutebooks.com/how-to-become-a-straight%E2%80%91a-student-summary/
Blog posts
Cal Newport
May 18th, 2011 Â· 87 comments Scott Young's Graduation Gift to Study Hacks I have to give credit to Scott Young: it was talking blogs with him back in 2007 that helped convince me to start Study Hacks. The fact that I link to Scott's material again and again and again and again should tell you that we think in similar patterns.
https://www.calnewport.com/blog/category/tips-studying/
Podcasts
Episode 61 - Cal Newport Become A Straight A Student - Startup business advice and innovation tips: Moonshots Podcast
Cal Newport knows that real straight-A students don't study harder-they study smarter. In this episode we take a look at Cal Newport's breakthrough approach to acing assignments, from quizzes and exams to essays and papers, How to Become a Straight-A Student reveals the proven study secrets used by real straight-A students across the country.
https://www.moonshots.io/episode-61-cal-newport-become-a-straight-a-student
Interview: How to Become a Straight-A Student with Cal Newport - OPTIMIZE with Brian Johnson | More Wisdom in Less Time - Podcast
Cal Newport is a Phi Beta Kappa graduate of Dartmouth who went on to MIT for his Ph.D. and is now a Professor at Georgetown. In this book, Cal shares the top ideas he gleaned from interviews with non-...
https://podtail.com/en/podcast/optimize-with-brian-johnson-more-wisdom-in-le/interview-how-to-become-a-straight-a-student/
Videos
2012 Texas Regional Project, "Study 30 Minutes a Day, Get a 4.0 GPA!"
On February 15th, Dr. Calvin Newport, assistant professor of computer science at Georgetown University and author of several books including How to Become a Straight-A Student presented three unconventional student success concepts adopted from academic performance practices of high-achieving students at Ivy-League schools to the Texas Region of Phi Theta Kappa in a webcast for participating local chapters in the 2012 Texas Regional Project entitled, Study 30 Minutes a Day, Get a 4.0 GPA!.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ppvVsSQa9gc
Studying through Active Recall
Uploaded by TheProjectKnowledge on 2013-07-07.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eL0QFTwgEgQ&t=4s
Scott Young
Scott young has not only been researching the most effective learning methods for over a decade, but has completed extreme projects personally such as completing an MIT computer science degree in a year.
Ultralearning
Guide to learning hard skills
Ultralearning | Scott H Young
A four-year degree used to be a guarantee for a great career. Now it's barely a foot in the door. Tuition prices have skyrocketed. The pace of change has accelerated. Technology has transformed how we access information, but instead of making us all geniuses, we mostly waste time looking at funny pictures of cats.
https://www.scotthyoung.com/blog/ultralearning/
Blog
Articles | Scott H Young
If you're just coming to this blog for the first time, here's what you should read first: 5 Scientific Steps to Ace Your Next Exam - What does research tell us about the best way to learn faster? Here are five evidence-based steps you can apply to pass your next exam (or learn anything better).
https://www.scotthyoung.com/blog/articles/
Blog in Podcast Form
Podcast | Scott H Young
https://www.scotthyoung.com/blog/podcast/
Josh Waitzkin
Learn from a tai chi and chess world champion
The Art of Learning
The Art of Learning - Josh Waitzkin
AUDIO BOOK - NOW AVAILABLE Narrated by Josh Waitzkin In stories ranging from his early years taking on chess hustlers as a seven year old in New York City's Washington Square Park, to dealing with the pressures of having a film made about his life, to International Chess Championships in India, Hungary, and Brazil, to gripping battles against powerhouse fighters in Taiwan in the Push Hands World Championships, The Art of Learning encapsulates an extraordinary competitor's life lessons in a pause-resisting narrative.
https://www.joshwaitzkin.com/the-art-of-learning
Summary
The Art of Learning - Actionable Books
"...there will be nothing learned from any challenge in which we don't try our hardest. Growth comes at the point of resistance. We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities."
https://www.actionablebooks.com/en-ca/summaries/the-art-of-learning/
Podcast
The Art of Learning: The Tool of Choice for Top Athletes, Traders, and Creatives
This post is about the third book in the Tim Ferriss Book Club, which is limited to books that have dramatically impacted my life. Enjoy! "I strongly recommend [The Art of Learning] for anyone who lives in a world of competition, whether it's sports or business or anywhere else."
https://tim.blog/2014/03/20/the-art-of-learning-joshua-waitzkin/
Josh Waitzkin: How to Cram 2 Months of Learning Into 1 Day - The Tim Ferriss Show - Podcast Notes
Check out The Tim Ferriss Show Episode Page & Show Notes Key Takeaways No matter what you're practicing, always finish strong Align your peak energy periods with peak creativity work and actually schedule thinking time into your calendar An exercise that's helped Josh and many of his clients: End your
https://podcastnotes.org/2019/06/27/waitzkin/
Barbara Oakley
From failing algebra in High School to becoming an Engineering Professor.
A Mind For Numbers
How to Excel at Math and Science (Even if you flunked algebra). I use every rule in this book. It contains analogies, graphics, and some necessary mindset shifts.
A Mind For Numbers | Barbara Oakley
Downloadable, Printable Posters: 10 Rules of Good Studying; 10 Rules of Bad Studying Whether you are a student struggling to fulfill a math or science requirement, or you are embarking on a career change that requires a new skill set, A Mind for Numbers offers the tools you need to get a better grasp of...
https://barbaraoakley.com/books/a-mind-for-numbers/
Videos
Learning how to learn | Barbara Oakley | TEDxOaklandUniversity
This talk was given at a local TEDx event, produced independently of the TED Conferences. Engineering professor Barbara Oakley is co-teaching one of the world's largest online classes, "Learning How to Learn", https://www.coursera.org/course/learning. She know firsthand how it feels to struggle with math.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O96fE1E-rf8
Khan Academy Live! In Khanversation with Barbara Oakley
Join Sal Khan as he welcomes author and professor Barbara Oakley to the Khan Academy offices to discuss education and mastery learning.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lR5Z0OnzE0g
The Science of Learning: How to Turn Information into Intelligence | Barbara Oakley
New videos DAILY: https://bigth.ink Join Big Think Edge for exclusive video lessons from top thinkers and doers: https://bigth.ink/Edge ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The great myth of the left brain versus right brain personality types has been popular for years. Even comedian Bo Burnham has turned this classic clichÃ© into a successful song for his tour.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1FvYJhpNvHY
Podcast
Learning How to Learn with Barbara Oakley [The Knowledge Project Ep. #31]
In this interview, Barbara Oakley (@barbaraoakley), 8-time author and creator of Learning to Learn, an online course with over a million enrolled students, shares the science and strategies to learn more quickly, overcome procrastination and get better at practically anything. Listen and Learn with The Knowledge Project on Apple | Spotify | Android | Google ...
https://fs.blog/2018/04/learning-barbara-oakley/
Poster to remind yourself of the rules
ECS_GoodStudyPoster_36x48_PRINT.pdf
1068.0KB
YouTube Channels
Ali Abdaal
Ali shows practical uses of evidence based study tips as a Medical Graduate from Cambridge University. Great if you want ideas from Cal Newport in video form
Evidence-Based Study Tips - YouTube
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL7BImOT2srcGCCjBBwNvU5zaB9F30lWye
Mariana's Study Corner
Mariana has beautiful evidence based videos. She comes from the perspective of a law graduate and current PhD student.
10 study tips that *actually* work
For a limited time, you can get 3 months of Audible for just $6.95 a month. That's more than half off the regular price. Choose 1 audiobook and 2 Audible Originals absolutely free. Visit https://audible.com/mariana or text mariana to 500 500. 1.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Et71Bzrmoe4&list=PLeMrc9psFYLJ-ca_eaQIwS5v0acKCy2Cw
Thomas Frank
Collates ideas from the best learning resources
Taking Notes: Crash Course Study Skills #1
The first step in honing your new study skills is to take better notes. This week Thomas will tell you everything you need to know to come to class prepared and find a note-taking system that will help you retain and review like a champ. Crash Course is made with Adobe Creative Cloud.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E7CwqNHn_Ns&list=PLx65qkgCWNJKHcoJzgJ8xd97JbS64e4xE
His book is a complete guide to getting better grades, but can applied to learning anything
https://collegeinfogeek.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/10steps-reddit.pdf
Applying Popular Strategies
Active Recall
How To Use Active Recall In Notion - Red Gregory
I've been using Notion since the beginning of the school year and it's been an amazing experience so far. I managed to figure out how to implement "Active Recall" that shows me my progress and what I need to do next according to my recall status, etc.
https://www.redgregory.com/notion/2019/12/5/how-to-use-active-recall-in-notion
Study with Me + Active Recall tips | Life as a Junior Doctor
Another study with me video! Today we're continuing the journey of preparing for the ALS (Advanced Life Support) course, and along the way I share some pointers for how to effectively use Active Recall.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YHJzSbLiQNs
Spaced Repetition
Anki - powerful, intelligent flashcards
Choose a platform from the left. Upgrading from Anki 2.0.x? If so, please uninstall the old version first. Uninstalling will not delete your card data. Download Anki for 64 bit Windows 7/8/10 (2.1.15-standard) Download Anki for 32 bit Windows 7/8/10 (2.1.15-alternate) If in doubt, choose the standard version, as most Windows installations are 64 bit these days.
https://apps.ankiweb.net/
Level Up Your Learning with Anki and Spaced Repetition
Anki is a software for creating cards similar to flashcards but the real power comes from the algorithm it uses to implement spaced repetition learning. This article will cover a few different methods for studying, setup, usage of Anki and best practices for effective learning. This article is not a sponsored post for Anki.
https://medium.com/swlh/level-up-your-learning-with-anki-and-spaced-repetition-3c1a84003ced
Advice I've taken
Active Recall. I create questions before every lecture based on the slides given in class. I will make my notes after and during class based on the questions.
Spaced repetition. I schedule when I will review my questions, typically 3 days after a lecture
Practice problems from Cal Newport. I avoid rereading notes and almost always do every practice problem available over reading a textbook
Diffuse Mode vs Focus Mode from Barbara Oakley. If I'm stuck on a problem I will stop focusing on the problem to allow myself to ponder it in a diffuse state
